description.p: The Broxclaw are a strong and resilient race of humanoid badgers, known for their physical power, druidic magic, and deep connection to nature. These black-and-white-striped beings stand tall on two legs, radiating both strength and wisdom. With their sturdy build and nomadic lifestyle, the Broxclaw are a formidable presence, both in battle and in the wild.

The Broxclaw live a nomadic life, avoiding big cities in favor of the untamed wilderness. They travel from place to place, often in small, close-knit groups, setting up temporary camps in secluded forests or rugged hills. They choose this lifestyle to stay connected to nature, which they see as the source of their strength and magic. Rarely do they settle in one spot for long, preferring the freedom of the open road and the ever-changing landscape.

Broxclaw society is deeply rooted in druidic magic. They have a natural talent for harnessing the primal forces of nature, which they use to great effect in battle. By combining their raw physical strength with nature's magic, Broxclaw warriors are a powerful force. Their magic often enhances their physical abilities, protects them with natural elements, or unleashes the fury of the wild on their enemies. This unique blend of druidic power and brute strength makes them versatile and unpredicatable fighters.

Physically, the Broxclaw are large for medium-sized creatures, usually standing a bit over 7 feet tall with broad shoulders and muscular bodies. Their fur is often striped in black and white, much like the badgers they resemble. The Broxclaw's physical strength is matched by their mental toughness; they are known for their stubbornness and determination, traits that help them survive in the wild.
The names for Broxclaws typically draw on their tenacious, burrowing, and fierce nature. These creatures might have names that evoke strength, persistence, or ties to the earth.

Names:Burrowgrin, Tuskthorn, Durgar, Grimclaw, Ruggedfang, Thornroot, Garrek, Stonepelt, Braylock, Orrik, Earthmaw, Thistleclaw, Mossra, Grizzlefur, Roottail, Duralis, Briarcoat, Tarka, Fernclaw, Harliss
Ability Score Increase. Your Strength is increased by 2 and your Constitution is increased by 1.
Age. Broxclaws mature by age 15 and can live up to 120 years.
Alignment. Broxclaws tend toward true neutrality, valuing balance and survival above rigid codes of conduct. However, their alignment can vary based on personal experiences.
Size. Broxclaws are medium creatures, typically standing over 7 feet tall with broad, muscular builds.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You also have a burrow speed equal to half your walking speed
Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light.
Everpresent Guardian. You gain proficiency in the Perception skill. Additionally, you have advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
Adaptive Brawler. You gain proficiency with medium armor and improvised weapons.

Reinforced Sticks. You know the Shillelagh cantrip. You can cast it on any improvised weapon you are holding, not just clubs and quarterstaffs. Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
Powerful Build.You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

Platecrusher.When you hit a creature wearing armor or wielding a shield with a melee weapon attack, you can reduce its AC by half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) for 1 minute. You can use this feature a number of these equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses after a long rest.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.
